About Me

Bio

I am a developer and a former professional dancer. I had a career in dance for more than twenty years throughout Mexico, Italy, and New York City. I had the pleasure to be on big stages including, Teatro dellâ€™Opera di Roma, Bellas Artes (Mexico), Muscat Opera House (Oman), Town Hall (NYC). My last big production was with Calpulli Mexican Dance Company. A Queens, NY, based Mexican folk dance company. I participated in two of their ballet - folklore productions.

As I was wrapping up my dance career, I developed a great interest in the intersection of technology and sustainability. I took action by devoting time to online courses, and that is how I discovered my passion for code, which led me to enroll in The Flatiron School.

At Flatiron, I did an immersive Full stack software engineering program. Over 500 hours of on campus learning. The curriculum includes: Ruby on Rails, Javascript and React. This has been a major decision decision in my life, gateway to transition into a new career. The program's most valuable gift is teaching how to learn, problem solving and interacting with people that share similar interests.

An essential component of my transition into tech is to find a company that is a leader in its industry and also aligns with my values, providing an opportunity to make a real difference with code.

I am excited about great ideas that bring together groups of people to work on innovative solutions.

My artistic background has given me the opportunity to travel, work with people from different backgrounds and develop a deep commitment to focusing and learning fast.

I have great enthusiasm and self-motivation to learn new things to add to my skill set, one of the things I enjoy the most.

I'm a native Spanish speaker, English is my second language, and I am also fluent in Italian.
